description: Returns a description of the gateway volumes specified in the request. This operation is only supported in the cached volume gateway types. The list of gateway volumes in the request must be from one gateway. In the response, Storage Gateway returns volume information sorted by volume Amazon Resource Name (ARN).

nested_items.name: CachediSCSIVolumes
nested_items.description: An array of objects where each object contains metadata about one cached volume.

nested_items.name: VolumeARN
nested_items.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the storage volume.

nested_items.name: VolumeId
nested_items.description: The unique identifier of the volume, e.g., vol-AE4B946D.

nested_items.name: VolumeType
nested_items.description: One of the VolumeType enumeration values that describes the type of the volume.

nested_items.name: VolumeStatus
nested_items.description: One of the VolumeStatus values that indicates the state of the storage volume.

nested_items.name: VolumeAttachmentStatus
nested_items.description: A value that indicates whether a storage volume is attached to or detached from a gateway. For more information, see Moving your volumes to a different gateway.

nested_items.name: VolumeSizeInBytes
nested_items.description: The size, in bytes, of the volume capacity.

nested_items.name: VolumeProgress
nested_items.description: Represents the percentage complete if the volume is restoring or bootstrapping that represents the percent of data transferred. This field does not appear in the response if the cached volume is not restoring or bootstrapping.

nested_items.name: SourceSnapshotId
nested_items.description: If the cached volume was created from a snapshot, this field contains the snapshot ID used, e.g., snap-78e22663. Otherwise, this field is not included.

nested_items.name: VolumeiSCSIAttributes
nested_items.description: An  VolumeiSCSIAttributes object that represents a collection of iSCSI attributes for one stored volume.

nested_items.name: TargetARN
nested_items.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the volume target.

nested_items.name: NetworkInterfacePort
nested_items.description: The port used to communicate with iSCSI targets.

nested_items.name: ChapEnabled
nested_items.description: Indicates whether mutual CHAP is enabled for the iSCSI target.

nested_items.name: CreatedDate
nested_items.description: The date the volume was created. Volumes created prior to March 28, 2017 don't have this timestamp.

nested_items.name: VolumeUsedInBytes
nested_items.description: The size of the data stored on the volume in bytes. This value is calculated based on the number of blocks that are touched, instead of the actual amount of data written. This value can be useful for sequential write patterns but less accurate for random write patterns. VolumeUsedInBytes is different from the compressed size of the volume, which is the value that is used to calculate your bill.

nested_items.name: KMSKey
nested_items.description: Optional. The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of a symmetric customer master key (CMK) used for Amazon S3 server-side encryption. Storage Gateway does not support asymmetric CMKs. This value must be set if KMSEncrypted is true, or if EncryptionType is SseKms or DsseKms.

nested_items.name: TargetName
nested_items.description: The name of the iSCSI target used by an initiator to connect to a volume and used as a suffix for the target ARN. For example, specifying TargetName as myvolume results in the target ARN of arn:aws:storagegateway:us-east-2:111122223333:gateway/sgw-12A3456B/target/iqn.1997-05.com.amazon:myvolume. The target name must be unique across all volumes on a gateway.
